isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - CAB ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - EATON VORAD COLLISION AVOIDANCE EVT-300

svcproc.title: EATON VORAD COLLISION AVOIDANCE EVT-300
svcproc.para: The EATON VORAD Collision Avoidance EVT-300 CPU receives switched ignition power from the (I2) ignition adapter through 5A fuse F10-B. Ground for the CPU is supplied from the (G1) ground adapter. The CPU is connected to the driver display unit on circuits 73U, 73V, 73W and 73X. The CPU is connected to the front antenna unit on circuits 73B, 73C, 73D and 73E. The CPU is connected to the right side sensor unit on circuits 73L, 73M and 73N. The CPU is connected to the right side display unit on circuits 73L, 73N and 73P. The CPU is connected to the truck data link on circuits 98YL9(+) and 98GN9(-), also 98EV(+) and 98EV(-).
